</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 107.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	For the sales of completed units, revenues are recognized upon completion of the sale and the transfer
	of significant risks and benefits, regardless of the timing of receipt from the customer.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 107.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	For the construction phase of units sold, but not yet completed:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 129PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The incurred cost (including cost of land,
	and other directly related expenditures) that corresponds to the units sold is included in profit or loss. For the units not yet
	sold, the incurred cost is included in inventory (Note 2.2.7);
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 129PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Sales revenues are appropriated to profit
	or loss, using the percentage-of-completion method for each project, this percentage being measured in view of the incurred cost
	in relation to the total estimated cost of the respective project;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 129PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Revenue recognized in excess of actual payments
	received from customers is recorded as either a current or non-current asset in &ldquo;Trade accounts receivable&rdquo;. Any payment
	received in connection with the sales of units that exceeds the amount of revenue recognized is recorded as &ldquo;Payables for
	purchase of land and advances from customers &quot;;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 129PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Interest and inflation-adjustment charges
	on accounts receivable from the time the units are sold and delivered, as well as the adjustment to present value of account receivable,
	are included in &ldquo;Real estate development, sale, barter transactions and construction services&rdquo; when incurred, on a
	pro rata basis using the accruals basis of accounting;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 129PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Financial charges on accounts payable for
	acquisition of land and those directly associated with the financing of construction are capitalized and recorded in properties
	for sale and included in the incurred cost of units under construction until their completion, and follow the same recognition
	criteria as the cost of real estate development for units sold while under construction;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">

</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Recognition of revenue and expenses
</U>
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Real estate development and sales
</I>
	--Continued
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 129PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Taxes levied and deferred on the difference
	between real estate development revenues and the cumulative revenue subject to tax are calculated and recognized when this difference
	in revenue is recognized; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 129PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Other expenses, including advertising and
	publicity, are recognized in profit or loss when incurred.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Construction services
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	Revenues from
	real estate services are recognized as services are rendered and tied to the construction management activities for third parties
	and technical advisory services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Barter transactions
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	Barter transactions
	have the objective of receiving land from third parties that are settled with the delivery of real estate units or transfer of
	portions of the revenue from the sale of real estate units of ventures. The value of the land acquired is determined on the fair
	value of the units to be delivered, as a component of &ldquo;properties for sales&rdquo;, with a corresponding entry to &ldquo;payable
	for purchase of properties and advances from customers&rdquo;. Revenues and costs incurred from barter transactions are included
	in profit or loss over the course of construction period of ventures, as previously described in item (b).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.3.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Financial instruments
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Financial instruments are recognized
	from the date the Company becomes a party to the contractual provisions of financial instruments, which mainly comprise cash and
	cash equivalents, short-term investments, accounts receivable, loans and financing, suppliers, and other debts.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	After initial recognition, financial
	instruments are measured as described below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 175 -->

	F-

	18

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.3.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Financial instruments
</U>
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Financial instruments at fair value through profit or loss
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	A
	financial instrument is classified at fair value through profit or loss when it is designated as such upon initial recognition,
	or
</FONT>
	when it meets the definition of a derivative and hedge accounting is not applied
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Financial instruments are designated
	at fair value through profit or loss if the Company manages these investments and makes purchase and sale decisions based on their
	fair value in accordance with the Company&rsquo;s documented investment strategy or risk management. Financial instruments at fair
	value through profit or loss are measured at fair value, and their changes therein are recognized in profit or loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	For the year ended December 31,
	2015, the Company held derivative financial instruments with the objective of mitigating the risk of its exposure to the volatility
	of indices and interest rates, recognized at the fair value directly in profit or loss. In accordance with its treasury policies,
	the Company does not have or issue derivative financial instruments for purposes other than to mitigate risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company does not adopt the
	hedge accounting practice.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Financial assets
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Financial assets are classified into financial assets at fair value through profit or loss,
	receivables, held-to-maturity investments and available-for-sale financial assets. The Company determines the classification of
	its financial assets upon initial recognition, when the Company becomes a party to the contractual provisions of the instrument.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Financial assets are initially recognized at fair value, plus, in the case of investments
	not measured at fair value through profit or loss, directly attributable transaction costs.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The financial assets of the Company include cash and cash equivalents, short-term investments,
	trade accounts receivable and derivative financial instruments.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>

<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.3.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Financial instruments
</U>
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	(ii)&#9;
<I>
	Financial assets
</I>
	--Continued
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Derecognition (write-off)
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	A financial asset (or, as the case may be, a portion of a financial asset or portion of a
	group of similar financial assets) is derecognized when:
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 104.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The contractual rights to the cash flows from
	the asset expire; or
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 104.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company transfers the rights to receive cash
	inflows of an asset or assume an obligation of fully pay the cash inflows received, without significant delay, to a third party
	because of a &ldquo;transfer&rdquo; agreement; and (a) the Company substantially transfers the risks and rewards of the asset,
	or (b) the Company does not substantially transfer or retain all risks and rewards related to the asset, but transfers the control
	over the asset.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 104.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	When
	the Company has transferred its rights to receive cash inflows of an asset, and signed an agreement to pass it on, and has not
	substantially transferred or has retained all risks and rewards related to the asset, an asset is recognized to the extent of the
	continuous involvement of the Company with the asset. In this case, the Company also recognizes a related liability. The transferred
	asset and related liability are measured based on the rights and obligations that the Company has maintained.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 104.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 104.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	continuous involvement by means of a guarantee on the transferred asset is measured at the lower of the original carrying value
	of the asset, or the highest consideration that may be required from the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 104.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(iii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Financial liabilities
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Financial liabilities through profit or loss include trading financial liabilities and financial
	liabilities designated as such upon initial recognition.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Loans and financing
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Subsequent to initial recognition, loans and financing accruing interest are measured at
	amortized cost, using the effective interest rate method. Gains and losses are recognized in statement of profit or loss, at the
	time liabilities are written-off, as well as during the amortization process using the effective interest rate method.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	A financial liability is derecognized when its contractual obligations are discharged, cancelled
	or expired.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	When an existing financial liability is substituted by another from the same creditor, under
	substantially different terms, or when the terms of an existing liability are significantly modified, this substitution or change
	is treated as a derecognition of the original liability and recognition of a new liability. The difference in the corresponding
	carrying values is recognized in profit or loss.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Financial
	instrument &ndash; net presentation
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Financial
	assets and liabilities are stated at their net amounts in the balance sheet when, and only when, there is a current and enforceable
	legal right to offset the amounts, and if there is intention to offset them or realize the asset and settle the liability simultaneously.
	The legal right shall not be contingent in future events and shall be applicable in the normal course of business, and in case
	of default, insolvency or bankruptcy of the company or counterparty.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.4.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Cash and cash equivalents and short-term investments
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Cash and cash equivalents substantially
	comprise demand deposits and bank certificates of deposit held under resale agreements, denominated in Reais, with high market
	liquidity and original contractual maturities of 90 days or less, and for which there are no penalties or other restrictions for
	the immediate redemption thereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Cash equivalents are classified
	as financial assets at fair value through profit or loss and are recorded at the original amounts plus income earned, calculated
	on a &ldquo;pro rata basis&quot;, which are equivalent to their market values, not having any impact to be accounted for in the
	Company&rsquo;s equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Short-term investments include
	bank deposit certificates, federal government bonds, exclusive investment funds that are fully consolidated and also restricted
	cash in guarantees to loans, which are classified at fair value through profit or loss (Note 4.2).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 178 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	21

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.5.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Trade account receivable
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	These are presented at present
	and realizable values. The classification between current and noncurrent is made based on the expected maturity of contract installments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The installments due are indexed
	based on the National Civil Construction Index (INCC) during the period of construction, and based on the General Market Prices
	Index (IGP-M) and interest at 12% p.a., after the delivery of the units.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The adjustment to present value
	is calculated between the contract signature date and the estimated date to transfer the completed property keys to the buyer,
	using a discount rate represented by the average rate of the financing obtained by the Company, net of inflation, as mentioned
	in Note 2.2.20.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The amortization of the present
	value adjustment, considering that an important part of the Company operations consists of financing its clients until key delivery,
	was carried out as contra-entry to the group of &ldquo;Real estate development, sale, barter transactions and construction services&rdquo;revenue,
	consistently with interest accrued on the portion of receivables balance related to the period subsequent to the handover of keys.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.6.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Mortgage-backed Securities (CRIs) and Housing Loan Certificate (CCI)
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	carry out the assignment and/or securitization of receivables related to completed projects and those still under construction.
	This securitization is carried out through the issuance of the &ldquo;Housing Loan Certificate&rdquo; (&ldquo;C&eacute;dula de
	Cr&eacute;dito Imobili&aacute;rio&rdquo; or &ldquo;CCI&rdquo;), which is assigned to financial institutions that grant loans. When
	there is no right of recourse, this assignment is recorded as reduction of accounts receivable. When there is right of recourse
	against the Company, the assigned receivable is maintained in the balance sheet and the funds from assignment are classified into
	the account &ldquo;Obligations assumed on assignment of receivable&rdquo;, until receivables are settled by customers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In this situation, the transaction
	cost is recorded in &ldquo;financial expenses&rdquo; in the statement of profit or loss for the year in which the transfer is made.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The financial guarantees, when
	a participation is acquired (subordinated CRI) and maintained to secure disposed receivables, are recorded on the balance sheet
	as &ldquo;short-term investments&rdquo; at the realizable value, which is equivalent to fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 179 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	22

<B>
	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.7.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Properties for sale
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	acquire land for future real estate developments, on payment conditions in currency or through barter transactions. Land acquired
	through barter transaction is stated at fair value of the units to be delivered, and the revenue and cost are recognized according
	to the criteria described in Note 2.2.2 (iii).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Properties are measured at the
	lower of construction cost, and net realizable value. In the case of real estate under construction, the portion in inventories
	corresponds to the cost incurred for units that have not yet been sold. The incurred cost comprises construction costs (materials,
	own or outsourced labor, and other related items), and legal expenses relating to the acquisition of land and projects, land costs
	and financial charges which relate to a project over the construction period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The classification of land between
	current and noncurrent assets is made by Management based on the expected period for launching real estate ventures. Management
	periodically revises the estimates of real estate ventures launches.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.8.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Selling expenses - commissions
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Brokerage expenditures are recorded
	in profit or loss under the account &ldquo;Selling expenses&rdquo; employing the same percentage-of-completion criteria used for
	revenue recognition. The charges related to sales commission paid by the buyer to their broker are not recognized as revenue or
	expense of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.9.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Prepaid expenses
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	These are recognized in profit
	or loss as incurred using the accrual basis of accounting.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 180 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	23
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage181"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: BOLD 8PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.10.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Land available for sale
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Land available for sale is measured
	at the lower of the carrying value and the fair value less the costs to sell and is classified as held for sale if its carrying
	value is to be recovered through a sale transaction of the land. This condition is considered fulfilled only when the sale is highly
	probable and the asset is available for immediate sale in its current condition. Management shall undertake to sell it in a year
	after the classification date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.11.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Investments in associates
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Investments in associates are recorded
	in the Company using the equity method.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	When the Company's equity in the
	losses of associates is equal to or higher than the amount invested, the Company recognizes the residual portion in net capital
	deficiency since it assumes obligations and makes payments on behalf of these companies. For this purpose, the Company recognizes
	a provision at an amount considered appropriate to meet the obligations of the associates (Note 9).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.12.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Property and equipment
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Items of property and equipment
	are measured at cost, less accumulated depreciation and/or any accumulated impairment losses, if applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	An item of property and equipment
	is derecognized when no future economic benefits are expected from its use or disposal. The gain or loss arising from derecognition
	of an asset (calculated as the difference between the net disposal proceeds and the carrying value of the asset) is recognized
	in profit or loss upon derecognition.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Depreciation is calculated based
	on the straight-line method considering the estimated useful lives of the assets (Note 10).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Expenditures incurred in the construction
	of sales stands, display apartments and related furnishings are capitalized as property and equipment of the Company and its subsidiaries.
	Depreciation of these assets commences upon launch of the development and is recorded over the average term the stand is in use
	and is written-off when it is retired.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Property and equipment are subject
	to periodic assessments of impairment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 181 -->

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.13.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Intangible assets
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Expenditures related to the acquisition and implementation of computer systems and software licenses
	are recorded at acquisition cost and amortized on straight-line basis over a period of up to five years, and are subject to periodic
	assessments of impairment of assets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company&rsquo;s investments in subsidiaries include goodwill when the acquisition cost exceeds
	the market value of net assets of the acquiree.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The goodwill recorded as of December
	31, 2015 and 2014 refers to acquisitions before the date of transition to CPC/IFRS (January 1, 2009), and the Company opted to
	not retrospectively recognize the acquisitions of investments before the transition date, to adjust any of the respective goodwill.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Impairment testing of goodwill
	is performed at least annually or whenever circumstances indicate an impairment loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.14.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Payables for purchase of properties and advances from customer due to barter
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Payables for purchase of land are
	recognized at the amounts corresponding to the contractual obligations assumed. Subsequently they are measured at amortized cost,
	plus interest and charges proportional to the incurred period (&ldquo;pro rata&rdquo; basis), net of present value adjustment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The obligations related to barter
	transactions of land in exchange for real estate units are stated at fair value of the units to be delivered.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 182 -->

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.15.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Income tax and social contribution
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Current income tax and social contribution
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Current income tax is the expected
	tax payable or receivable/to be offset in relation to taxable profit for the year. In the year 2014, the Company and its subsidiaries
	used the Brazilian Transitory Tax Regime (RTT), which permitted the exclusion of the effect from the changes, introduced by Laws
	No. 11,638/2007 and No. 11,941/2009, in the tax basis of such taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Income taxes in Brazil comprise
	income tax (25%) and social contribution (9%), for entities on the standard profit regime, for which the composite statutory rate
	is 34%. Deferred taxes for these entities are recognized on all temporary tax differences at the reporting date between the tax
	bases of assets and liabilities, and their carrying values.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As permitted by tax legislation,
	certain subsidiaries opted for the presumed profit regime, a method under which the taxable profit is calculated as a percentage
	of gross sales. For these companies, the income tax is calculated on estimated profits at rate of 8% and 12% of gross revenues,
	respectively, on which the rates of the respective tax and contribution are levied.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As permitted by tax legislation,
	the development of certain ventures are subject to the &ldquo;afeta&ccedil;&atilde;o&rdquo; regime, based on which the land and
	its features where a real estate will be developed, as well as other binding assets and rights, are separated from the assets of
	the developer and comprise the &ldquo;patrim&ocirc;nio de afeta&ccedil;&atilde;o&rdquo; (detached assets) of the corresponding
	development and which real estate units will be delivered to the buyers. In addition, certain subsidiaries made the irrevocable
	option for the Special Taxation Regime (RET), adopting the &quot;patrim&ocirc;nio de afeta&ccedil;&atilde;o&quot;, according to
	which the income tax and social contribution are calculated at 1.92% on gross revenues (4% also levying PIS and COFINS on revenues).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 183 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	26
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

<B>
	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	statements--Continued
</FONT>

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.15.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Income tax and social contribution
</U>
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Deferred income tax and social contribution
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Deferred taxes are recognized
	in relation to tax losses and temporary differences between the carrying amount of assets and liabilities for accounting purposes
	and the corresponding amounts used for tax purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Deferred tax assets are recognized
	to the extent that it is probable that future taxable income will be available to be used to offset deferred tax assets, based
	on profit projections made using internal assumptions and considering future economic scenarios that make it possible their full
	or partial use, upon the recognition of a provision for the non-realization of the balance. The recognized amounts are periodically
	reviewed and the impacts of realization or settlement are reflected in compliance with tax legislation provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Deferred tax on accumulated tax
	losses does not have an expiration date, however, they can only be offset against up to 30% of the taxable profit for each year.
	Companies that opt for the presumed profit tax regime cannot offset tax losses for a period in subsequent years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Deferred tax assets and liabilities
	are stated at net amount in the balance sheet when there is the legal right and intention to offset them when determining the current
	taxes, related to the same legal entity and the same tax authority.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.16.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Other current and non-current liabilities
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	These liabilities are stated at
	their known or estimated amounts, plus, when applicable, adjustment for charges and inflation-indexed variations through the balance
	sheet date, which contra-entry is recorded in profit or loss. When applicable, current and non-current liabilities are recorded
	at present value based on interest rates that reflect the term, currency and risk of each transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 184 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	27
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

	&nbsp;

	Gafisa S.A.
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.17.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Stock option plans
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As approved by its Board of Directors,
	the Company offers executives and employees share-based compensation plans (&ldquo;Stock Options&rdquo;), as payments for services
	received.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The fair value of options is determined
	on the grant date, considering that it is recognized as expense in profit or loss (as contra-entry to equity), to the extent services
	are provided by employees and executives.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In an equity-settled transaction,
	in which the plan is modified, a minimum expense is recognized corresponding to the expense that would have been recorded if the
	terms have not been changed. An additional expense is recognized for any modification that increases the total fair value of granted
	options, or that otherwise benefits the employee, measured on the modification date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In case of cancellation of a stock
	option plan, this is treated as if it had been vested on the cancellation date, and any unrecognized plan expense is immediately
	recognized. However, if a new plan replaces the cancelled plan, and a substitute plan is designated on the grant date, the cancelled
	plan and the new plan are treated as if they were a modification of the original plan, as previously mentioned.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company annually revises its
	estimates of the amount of options that shall be vested, considering the vesting conditions not related to the market and the conditions
	based on length of service. The Company recognizes the impact of the revision of the initial estimates, if any, in the statement
	of profit or loss, as contra-entry to equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.18.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Share-based payment &ndash; Phantom Shares
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company has a cash-settled share-based payment plan (phantom shares) under fixed terms
	and conditions. There is no expectation of the effective negotiation of shares, once there shall be no issue and/or delivery of
	shares for settling the plan.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	According to CPC 10 (R1) &ndash; Share-based Payment, these amounts are recorded as a liability,
	with contra-entry in profit or loss for the year, based on the fair value of the phantom shares granted, and during the vesting
	period. The fair value of this liability is remeasured and adjusted every reporting period, according to the change in the fair
	value of the benefit granted and vesting.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 185 -->

	F-
