</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.19.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Other employee benefits
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The salaries and benefits granted
	to the Company&rsquo;s employees and executives include fixed compensation (salaries, social security contributions (INSS), Government
	Severance Indemnity Fund for Employees (FGTS), vacation and 13th monthly salary, among others) and variable compensation such as
	profit sharing, bonus, and share-based payments. These benefits are recorded in profit or loss for the year, under the account
	&ldquo;General and administrative expenses&rdquo;, as they are incurred.&#9;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The bonus system operates with
	individual corporate targets, structured based on the efficiency of corporate goals, followed by the business goals and, finally,
	individual goals.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries do not offer private
	pension or retirement plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.20.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Present value adjustment &ndash; assets and liabilities
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Assets and liabilities arising
	from long or short-term transactions are adjusted to present value if significant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In installment sales of not completed
	units, real estate development entities adjust receivables by an inflation index, including the installment related to the delivery
	of units, without accrual of interest, and shall be discounted to present value, as the agreed inflation indexes do not include
	interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Borrowing and other financing costs
	directly attributable to the construction of real estate ventures are capitalized. Therefore, the reversal of the present value
	adjustment of an obligation related to these items is included in the cost of real estate unit sold or in the inventories of properties
	for sale, as the case may be, until the period of construction of the project is completed.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Accordingly, certain assets and
	liabilities are adjusted to present value based on discount rates that reflect the best estimate of the value of the money over
	time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The applied discount rate&rsquo;s
	underlying economic basis and assumption is the average rate of the financing and loans obtained by the Company, net of the inflation-index
	effect (Notes 5 and 12).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 186 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	29

	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.21.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Debenture and public offering costs
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Transaction costs and premiums
	on issuance of securities are accounted for as a direct reduction of amount raised by the Company. In addition, transaction costs
	and premiums on issuance of debt securities are amortized over the terms of the instrument and the net balance is classified as
	reduction of the respective transaction (Note
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
</FONT>
	13).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.22.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Borrowing costs
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Borrowing costs which are directly
	attributable to the development of assets for sale and land, are capitalized as part of the cost of that asset during the construction
	period, since there are borrowings outstanding, which are recognized in profit or loss to the extent units are sold. All other
	borrowing costs are expensed as incurred. Borrowing costs comprise interest and other related costs incurred, including those for
	raising finances.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.23.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Provisions
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Provisions are recognized when
	the Company has a present obligation as a result of a past event that can be estimated reliably, and it is probable that an outflow
	of economic benefits will be required to settle the obligation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Provision for legal claims
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company is party to various
	lawsuits and administrative proceedings. Provisions are recognized for all contingencies related to lawsuits, in which risk of
	loss is considered probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Contingent liabilities for which
	losses are considered possible are only disclosed in a note to the consolidated financial statements, and those for which losses
	are considered remote are neither accrued nor disclosed.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 187 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	statements--Continued
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.23.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Provisions
</U>
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 85.05PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Provision for legal claims
</I>
	--Continued
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Contingent assets are recognized
	only when there are real guarantees or favorable final and unappealable court decisions. Contingent assets with probable favorable
	decisions are only disclosed in the notes. As of December 31, 2015 and 2014 there are no claims involving contingent assets recorded
	in the consolidated balance sheet of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Allowance for doubtful account and cancelled contracts
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company reviews annually its
	assumptions related to the establishment of its allowance for doubtful account and cancelled contracts, taking into account the
	review of the histories of its current operations and improvement of estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company records an allowance
	for doubtful accounts and cancelled contracts for customers whose installments are past due, based on the assumptions made about
	each segment of the Company. This allowance is calculated based on the percentage of completion of the construction work, a methodology
	adopted for recognizing profit or loss for the year (Note 2.2.2).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<I>
	(iii)
</I>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Provision for penalties due to delay in construction work
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As contractually provided, the
	Company has the practice of provisioning the charges payable to eligible customers for projects whose delivery is delayed over
	180 days, pursuant to the respective contractual clause and history of payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<I>
	(iv)
</I>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Warranty provision
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries recognize a provision to cover expenditures for repairing construction
	defects covered during the warranty period, based on the estimate that considers the history of incurred expenditures adjusted
	by the future expectation, except for the subsidiaries that operate with outsourced companies, which are the direct guarantors
	of the constructions services provided. The warranty period is five years from the delivery of the venture.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 188 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	31
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

	statements--Continued

	December 31, 2015

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.23.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Provisions
</U>
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<I>
	(v)
</I>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
	Provision for impairment of non-financial assets
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	When there is evidence of
	impairment of asset, and the net carrying value exceeds the recoverable amount, a provision for impairment is recorded,
	adjusting the net carrying value to the recoverable value. Goodwill and intangible assets with indefinite useful lives have
	the recovery of their net carrying amounts tested annually, regardless whether there is any indication of impairment, by
	comparing the net carrying value to the recoverable amount measured by cash flows discounted to present value, using a
	discount rate before taxes, which reflects the weighted average cost of capital of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 107.75PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.24.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Sales taxes
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Expenses and assets are recognized
	net of sales taxes, except:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	When the sales taxes incurred in the purchase
	of goods or services are not recoverable from tax authorities, in which event sales taxes are recognized as a portion of the acquisition
	cost of the asset or expense item, as the case may be; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	When the amounts receivable and payable are
	shown together with the sales taxes.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 86.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	When the net amount of sales taxes, recoverable
	or payable, is included as a receivables or payable item in the balance sheet.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT">
	Under the non-cumulative taxation regime, the PIS
	and COFINS contribution rates are 1.65% and 7.6%, respectively, for companies under the taxable profit taxation regime, levied
	on gross revenue and discounting certain credits determined based on incurred costs and expenses. For companies that opt for the
	presumed profit taxation regime, under the cumulative taxation regime, the PIS and COFINS contribution rates are 0.65% and 3%,
	respectively, on gross revenue, without discounts of credits in relation to incurred costs and expenses. In addition, certain subsidiaries
	made the irrevocable option for the Special Taxation Regime (RET), adopting the &quot;patrim&ocirc;nio de afeta&ccedil;&atilde;o&quot;,
	according to which the PIS and COFINS are calculated at 0.37% and 1.71%, respectively, on gross revenue.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.25.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Treasury shares
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Own equity instruments that are
	repurchased (treasury shares) are recognized at cost and charged to equity. No gain or loss is recognized in the statement of profit
	or loss upon purchase, sale, issue or cancellation of the Company&rsquo;s own equity instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 189 -->

	F-

	&nbsp;
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Presentation of financial statements and summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of significant accounting policies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.26.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Interest on equity and dividends
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The portion of declared dividends
	and interest on equity (JCP) are recorded as current liabilities in the heading &ldquo;Dividends payable&rdquo;. Mandatory dividends
	are also recorded as current liabilities since it is a legal obligation provided for in the By-laws of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For corporate and accounting
	purposes, the interest on equity is reported as allocation of profit directly to equity at gross amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.27.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Earnings (loss) per share &ndash; basic and diluted
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Basic earnings (loss) per share
	are calculated by dividing the net income (loss) attributable (allocated) to ordinary shareholders by the weighted average number
	of shares outstanding over the period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Diluted earnings per share are
	calculated in a similar manner, except that the weighted average number of shares outstanding is increased, to include the additional
	shares that would be outstanding, in case the shares with dilutive potential attributable to stock option had been issued over
	the respective periods, using the weighted average price of shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.2.28.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Non-current assets
	held for sale and profit of discontinued operations
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: -36.85PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company classifies a non-current asset as held for sale if its carrying amount is expected
	to be recovered by means of a sale transaction. In such case, the asset or the group of assets held for sale must be available
	for immediate sale on current conditions, subject to the usual and customary terms for selling such assets held for sale and its
	sale must be highly probable.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	For
	a sale to be considered highly probable, Management must be committed to a plan to sell the asset, and have initiated a program
	for finding a buyer and complete the plan at a price that is reasonable in relation to its current fair value. In addition, the
	sale must be expected to be completed within one year after the classification date, unless events that are beyond the control
	of the Company change this period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.4PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	asset held for sale is measured at the lower of its carrying amount and fair value, less cost to sell. In case the carrying value
	exceeds its fair value, an impairment loss is recognized in profit or loss for the year. Any reversal or gain shall only be recognized
	to the extent of such recognized loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 86.45PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.4PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36.85PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The profit of discontinued operations is presented at a single amount in statement of profit
	or loss, which includes the total after-tax income of these operations, less any impairment-related loss. The net cash flow amounts
	attributable to operating, investing and financing activities of discontinued operations are presented in Note 8.2.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT">
	On December 9, 2013, the Company disclosed a material
	fact informing the completion of transaction for selling the majority interest (70%) it held in Alphaville Urbanismo S.A. (AUSA),
	as detailed in Note 8.2.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 190 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	33
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage191"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: BOLD 8PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD>
	New standards, changes and interpretation of standards issued and not yet adopted
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 9 &ndash; Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	IFRS 9 includes the reviewed guidance
	on classification and measurement of financial instruments, a new expected credit loss model for calculating the impairment of
	financial assets and new requirements for hedge accounting. The standard maintains the existing guidance on the recognition and
	derecognition of financial instruments of IAS 39. IFRS 9 is effective for years beginning on or after January 1, 2018.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 15 &ndash; Revenue from Contracts with Customers
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	This standard
	introduces new requirements for measurement and recognition of revenue . IFRS 15 &ndash; Revenue from Contracts with Customers,
	requires an entity to recognize the amount of revenue reflecting the consideration it expects to receive in exchange for the control
	over such goods or services. The new standard is going to replace existing revenue recognition guidance, including IAS 18, IAS
	11 and IFRIC 13. The new standard is applicable beginning on or after January 1, 2018. The standard can be applied retrospectively,
	adopting a cumulative effect approach.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 16 &ndash; Leases
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	This standard
	replaces the previous lease standard, IAS 17/CPC 06 (R1) &ndash; Leases, and related interpretation, and establishes the principles
	for the recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure of leases for both parties to a contract, that is, the customers
	(lessees) and providers (lessors). Lessees are required to recognize a lease liability reflecting the future lease payments and
	a &ldquo;right-of-use assets&rdquo; for practically all lease contracts, except certain short-term leases and contracts of low-value
	assets. For lessors, the criteria for recognition and measurement of leases in the financial statements are substantially maintained.
	This standard is effective beginning on January 1, 2019.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	The Company is evaluating the effects
	of the IFRS 9, 15 and 16 on its financial statements and has not yet concluded its analysis on the impact of their adoption.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	The Accounting Pronouncements Committee
	(CPC) has not yet issued an accounting pronouncement or change to effective pronouncements corresponding to all of the new IFRS.
	Accordingly, entities that disclose their financial statements according to the accounting practices adopted in Brazil are not
	permitted to early adopt such IFRS.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	There is no
	other standard, changes to standards or interpretation issued and not yet adopted that could, in the Management&rsquo;s opinion,
	have significant impact arising from their adoption on its financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 191 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	34
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Securities purchased under resale agreement comprise securities issued by Banks with a repurchase
	commitment by the bank, and resale commitment by the customer, at rates and maturities agreed upon, backed by private or government
	securities, depending on the bank. The securities are registered with Central de Cust&oacute;dia e de Liquida&ccedil;&atilde;o
	Financeira de T&iacute;tulos (&ldquo; CETIP&rdquo;)
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	As of December 31,
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2015,
</FONT>
	the securities purchased
	under resale agreement include interest earned
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	from 75% to 100.5%
</FONT>
	of Interbank Deposit Certificates
	(CDI) (from
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	70% to 101% of CDI in 2014).
</FONT>
	All transactions are with what management considers
	to be top tier financial institutions
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_64"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 70%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 49.6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(213,234,234)">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Structure of exclusive Investment funds aimed at earning interest on funds in excess of the variation
	in the Interbank Deposit Certificate (CDI). These funds have mandates of risks that are periodically monitored and observe the
	internal investment policies in effect.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015, Bank Certificates of Deposit (CDBs) include interest earned varying from
	90% to 107% (from 70% to 108% in 2014) of Interbank Deposit Certificates (CDI) rate. The CDBs earn an average income in excess
	of those from securities purchased under resale agreements; however, the Company performs investments in short term operations
	(up to 20 working days) through securities purchased under resale agreements mainly due to the exemption of IOF, which is not granted
	in the case of CDBs.&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Restricted cash in guarantee to loans are investments in fixed-income funds, with appreciation of
	shares through investments only in federal government bonds, indexed to fixed rates or to price indexes, and pledged to guarantee
	a portion of the Company&rsquo;s issuances. These amounts are periodically released, when there is a surplus of guarantee in the
	issuance and/or as provided for in the indenture. See further information in Notes 13 and 16(b).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Restricted credits are represented by onlending of the funds from associate credit (&ldquo;
<I>
	cr&eacute;dito
	associativo
</I>
	&rdquo;), a type of government real estate financing, which are in process of approval at the Caixa Econ&ocirc;mica
	Federal (a Federally owned Brazilian bank used for real estate financing purpose). These approvals are made to the extent the contracts
	signed with customers at the financial institutions are regularized, which the Company expect to be in up to 90 days.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	balance of accounts receivable from units sold and not yet delivered is not fully reflected in the consolidated financial statements.
	The balance is limited to the portion of the recorded revenues net of the amounts already received, according to the accounting
	practice mentioned in
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	Note 2.2.2(i)(b).
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	As
	of December 31, 2015, the amount received from customers in excess of the recognized revenues totaled R$39,743 (R$21,236 in 2014)
	in the consolidated financial statements, and are classified in the heading &ldquo;Payables for purchase of properties and advances
	from customers&quot; (Note 17).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Accounts
	receivable from completed real estate units financed by the Company are in general subject to IGP-M variation plus annual interest
	of 12%, with revenue being recorded in profit or loss in the account &ldquo;Revenue from real estate development and sale, barter
	transactions and construction services&quot;. The interest amounts recognized, in the consolidated financial statements for the
	year ended December 31,
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2015
</FONT>
	totaled
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	R$39,844 (R$36,216
	in 2014 and R$31,419 in 2013).
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	balances of allowance for doubtful accounts and cancelled contracts
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	,
</FONT>
	are considered sufficient
	by the Company&rsquo;s management to cover the estimated future losses on realization of the accounts receivable
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	reversal of the present value adjustment recognized in revenue from real estate development for the year ended December 31,
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	2015
	totaled R$6,410 (R$1,660 in 2014 and R$1,214 in 2013)
</FONT>
	in the consolidated financial statements
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Receivables
	from units not yet completed were measured at present value using a discount rate determined according to the criteria described
	in Note 2.2.2. The discount rate applied by the Company and its subsidiaries was
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	6.78% in 2015
	(3.27 to 4.64% in 2014),
</FONT>
	net of Civil Construction National Index (INCC)
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	Company entered into the following Real Estate Receivables Agreement (CCI) transactions, which are aimed to transfer a portfolio
	comprising select residential and business real estate receivables delivered and yet to be delivered arising out of Gafisa and
	its subsidiaries to the assignee. The assigned portfolios, discounted to present value, are recorded under the heading &ldquo;obligations
	assumed on the assignment of receivables&rdquo;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	5.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Trade accounts receivable of development and services
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In
	the transactions above, the Company and its subsidiaries are jointly responsible until the time of the transfer of the collateral
	to the securitization company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	For
	the items
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	(i) to (iii) and (viii)
</FONT>
	above, the Company was engaged to perform, among other
	duties, the management of the receipt of receivables, the assignment&rsquo;s underlying assets, and collection from defaulting
	customers, among other, according to the criteria of each investor, being paid for these services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	difference between the face value of the portfolio of receivables and the amount discounted to present value was recorded in profit
	or loss in the account &ldquo;Discount in Securitization Transaction&rdquo; under financial expenses
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</TD>

<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	6.
</FONT>

</TD>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">

	8.2
</FONT>
	Profit from discontinued operations

<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.05PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.05PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	On
	December 9, 2013, the Company disclosed the completion of the sale transaction of its 70% interest in AUSA. As a result of this
	transaction, a gain of R$631,122 was recorded in the Company&rsquo;s results under the heading &ldquo;Net income from discontinued
	operations&rdquo;, as shown below

	:

	analysis of impairment. At December 31, 2015, and 2014 there was no indication of impairment of property and equipment.

<BR STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	Other intangible assets comprise expenditures on the
	acquisition and implementation of information systems and software licenses, amortized over the average term of five years (20%
	per year).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	Goodwill arises from the difference between the consideration
	paid and the equity of acquirees, calculated on acquisition date, and is based on the expectation of future economic benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	The Company evaluated the recovery of the carrying
	value of goodwill using the &ldquo;value in use&rdquo; concept, applying discounted cash flow models of the cash-generating units.
	The process for determining the value in use involves the use of assumptions, judgments and estimates relating to cash flows, such
	as growth rate of revenues, costs and expenses, estimates of investment and future working capital, and discount rates. The assumptions
	relating to growth, cash flow and future cash flows are based on the Company&rsquo;s business plan, approved by the management,
	as well as on comparable market data, and represent the Management&rsquo;s best estimate of the economic conditions that will prevail
	during the economic life of the different cash-generating units, group of assets that provides the generation of cash flows. The
	future cash flows were discounted based on the rate representative of the cost of capital. Consistent with the economic valuation
	techniques, the evaluation of the value in use is made for a five-year period, and after such period, considering the perpetuity
	of assumptions in view of the capacity for indefinite business continuity. The main assumptions used in the estimate of value in
	use are the following: a) revenue &ndash; revenues were projected between 2016 and 2020 considering the growth in sales and client
	base of the different cash-generating units; b) Operating costs and expenses &ndash; costs and expenses were projected in line
	with the Company&rsquo;s historical performance, as well as the historical growth of revenues. The key assumptions were based on
	the Company&rsquo;s historical performance over the past five years and on reasonable macroeconomic assumptions, and supported
	by the financial market projections. The impairment test of the Company&rsquo;s intangible assets did not result in the need for
	recognizing a provision for impairment loss in the year ended December 31, 2015 (R$17,604 in 2014 and R$963 in 2013, related to
	the goodwill on acquisition of Cipesa).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 201 -->

	F-

	&nbsp;

</P>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The SFH financing is used for covering costs related to the development of real estate ventures of
	the Company and its subsidiaries, and are guaranteed with the first lien mortgage of real estate ventures and the fiduciary assignment
	of receivables.
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	Company and its subsidiaries have restrictive covenants under certain loans and financing that limit their ability to perform certain
	actions, such as the issuance of debt, and that could require the early redemption or refinancing of loans if the Company does
	not fulfill such covenants. The ratio and minimum and maximum amounts required under such restrictive covenants as of December
	31, 2015 and 2014 are disclosed in Note 13.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Financial
	expenses of loans, financing and debentures (Note 13) are capitalized at the cost of construction of each venture and land, according
	to the use of funds, and recognized in profit or loss for the year in proportion to the units sold, as shown below. The capitalization
	rate used in the determination of costs of loans eligible to capitalization ranges from 10.54% to 14.42% as of December 31, 2015
	(10.95% to 12.24% in 2014).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On May 29, 2015, the change in the schedule for amortization of principal was unanimously approved
	without any exception, and became effective at the following amounts and maturities: (i) R$25,000 on June 5, 2015; (ii) R$25,000
	on December 5, 2015; (iii) R$75,000 on June 5, 2016; (iv) R$75,000 on December 5, 2016; (v) R$150,000 on June 5, 2017; and (vi)
	R$150,000 on December 5, 2017.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 35.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31,
	2015, the Company made the payment in the total amount of R$104,993, of which R$50,000 related to the Face Value of the Placement,
	and R$54,993 related to the interest payable.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 35.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company made the payment in the total amount of R$164,885,
	of which R$144,213 related to the Face Value of the Placement, and R$20,704 related to the interest payable, thus settling all
	payables of the first series of the Eight Debenture Placement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On October 15, 2015, the Company made the payment in the total amount of R$9,371, of which R$8,089
	related to the Face Value of the second series of the Placement, and R$1,282 related to the interest payable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company made the payment in the total amount of R$24,317,
	of which R$1,294 related to the amortization of the Face Value of the Placement and R$23,023 related to the interest payable.
</TD>

	13.

<TD>
	Debentures
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On December 10, 2014, the Board of Directors of the Company approved the placement for private distribution
	of the 10
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	placement, being the 2
<SUP>
	nd
</SUP>
	private placement of unconvertible debentures, with floating and secured
	guarantee, in sole series in the amount of R$55,000, fully paid on January 30, 2015 and with final maturity on January 20, 2020.
	The funds raised in the placement shall be used for developing select real estate ventures and its secured guarantee is represented
	by the collateral of the lands owned by the Company to be developed in future periods. The Face Value of the Placement shall be
	adjusted by the cumulative variation of the IPCA and on it interest of 8.22% p.a. shall be accrued.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT">
	(vi)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31, 2015, the subsidiary Tenda made the payment in the total amount of
	R$220,415, of which R$180,000 related to the Face Value of the Placement and R$40,415 related to the interest payable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	on assignment of receivables

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Regarding
	the above transactions, except for item (a), the assignor is required to fully formalize the guarantee instruments of receivables
	in favor of the assignee. Until it is fully fulfilled, these amounts will be classified into a separate account in current and
	non-current liabilities
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	obligation of item (a), is guaranteed by the issuance of Subordinated Mortgage-backed Securities (CRI) limited to 4% of the issuance
	amount, not having right of recourse above this limit
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company entered in June 2011 into a private instrument for establishing the usufruct
	of 100% preferred shares of SPE-89 Empreendimentos Imobili&aacute;rios S.A., over a period of six years, raising funds amounting
	to R$45,000.
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	In the year ended December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
	the total amount of dividends paid to
	the holders of preferred shares by SPE-89 Empreendimentos Imobili&aacute;rios S.A. amounted to
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	R$ 8,000 (Note 9).
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->

<B>
	Gafisa S.A.
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	16.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Provisions for legal claims and commitments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	are parties to lawsuits and administrative proceedings at various courts and government agencies that arise from the ordinary course
	of business, involving tax, labor, civil and other matters. Management, based on information provided by its legal counsel and
	analysis of the pending claims and, with respect to the labor claims, based on past experience regarding the amounts claimed, recognized
	a provision in an amount considered sufficient to cover the losses on future settlements. The Company does not expect any reimbursement
	in connection with these claims.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the years ended December 31,
	2015 and 2014, the changes in the provision are summarized as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Civil lawsuits, tax proceedings and labor claims

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
</FONT>
	2015, the Company and its subsidiaries have deposited in court the amount of R$125,358 (R$154,939 in 2014) in the consolidated
	financial statements (Note 7).&nbsp;
</P>

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Gafisa S.A.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	16.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Provisions for legal claims and commitments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Civil lawsuits, tax proceedings and labor claims
</U>
	--Continued
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
</FONT>
	2015, the provisions related to civil claims
	include R$42,296 (R$65,016 in 2014) related to lawsuits in which the Company is included as successor in enforcement actions and
	in which the original debtor is a former shareholder of Gafisa, Cimob Companhia Imobili&aacute;ria (&ldquo;Cimob&rdquo;), or involve
	other companies of the same economic group of Cimob. In these lawsuits, the plaintiff believes that the Company should be liable
	for Cimob&rsquo;s debts, as the Company would have taken on the obligations of Cimob after acquisition (business succession, merger
	of assets and/or formation of a same economic group involving the Company and the Cimob Group). In addition, there are judicial
	deposits in the amount of R$44,099 (R$62,381 in 2014) related to these lawsuits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company does not agree with
	the statement of facts based on which it has been included in these lawsuits and continues to dispute in court its liability for
	the debts of a third company, as well as the amount charged by the plaintiffs. The Company has already obtained favorable and unfavorable
	decisions in relation to this matter, which is the reason why it is not possible to estimate a uniform outcome in all lawsuits.
	The Company also aims to file a lawsuit against Cimob and its former and current parent companies to argue that it should not be
	liable for the debts of that company, as well as indemnity of the amounts already paid by the Company in lawsuits relating to the
	charge of debts owed only by Cimob.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The former subsidiary AUSA, current associate, is a party to lawsuits and administrative proceedings
	related to Excise Tax (IPI) and State VAT (ICMS) on two imports of aircraft in 2001 and 2005, respectively, under lease agreements
	without purchase option.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	According to the negotiation of
	the sale of controlling interest of 70% in AUSA, it was agreed that the Company would cover the court costs in the event of unfavorable
	decision. The likelihood of loss in the ICMS case was reviewed in 2015, in view of case law, and considered remote by the legal
	counsel (R$16,638 in 2014, and it was classified as possible).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Environmental risk
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT">
	There are various environmental laws at the federal,
	state and municipal levels. These environmental laws may result in delays for the Company in connection with adjustments for compliance
	and other costs, and impede or restrict ventures. Before acquiring a land, the Company assesses all necessary and applicable environmental
	issues, including the possible existence of hazardous or toxic materials, residual substance, trees, vegetation and the proximity
	of the land to permanent preservation areas. Therefore, before acquiring land, the Company obtains all governmental approvals,
	including environmental licenses and construction permits.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 208 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	51
