<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	16.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Provisions for legal claims and commitments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Civil lawsuits, tax proceedings and labor claims
</U>
	--Continued
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Environmental risk--Continued
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT">
	In addition, environmental legislation establishes
	criminal, civil and administrative sanctions to individuals and legal entities for activities considered as environmental infringements
	or offense. The penalties include the stop of development activities, loss of tax benefits, confinement and fines. The lawsuits
	in dispute by the Company in civil court are considered by the legal advisor to have possible losses in the amount of R$8,639 (R$13,734
	in 2014).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Lawsuits in which likelihood of loss is rated as possible
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company
	and its subsidiaries are aware of other claims and civil, labor and tax risks. Based on the history of probable processes and the
	specific analysis of main claims, the measurement of the claims with likelihood of loss considered possible amounted to R$810,163
	(R$561,056 in 2014), based on average past outcomes adjusted to current estimates, for which the Company&rsquo;s Management believes
	it is not necessary to recognize a provision for losses. The change in the period was caused by the higher volume of lawsuits with
	smaller amounts and review of the involved amounts and tax proceedings in which subsidiary Tenda is defendant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>

</TD>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	66,387
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">

	&nbsp;

<B>
	810,163
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	561,056
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Payables related to the completion of real estate developments
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company commits to complete
	units sold and to comply with the laws regulating the civil construction sector, including the obtainment of licenses from the
	proper authorities, and compliance with the terms for starting and delivering the real estate developments, being subject to legal
	and contractual penalties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company
	and its subsidiaries have restricted cash which will be released to the extent the guarantee indexes described in Note 4.2 are
	met, which include land and receivables pledged in guarantee of 120% of the debt outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Other commitments
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In addition to the commitments
	mentioned in Notes 6, 12 and 13, the Company has commitments related to the rental of 33 properties where its facilities are located,
	at a monthly cost of R$1,155 adjusted by the IGP-M/FGV variation. The rental term is from 1 to 10 years and there is a fine in
	case of cancelled contracts corresponding to three-month rent or in proportion to the contract expiration time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	18.

</TD>
<TD>
	Equity
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
	18.1.
</TD>
<TD>
	Capital
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015 and 2014,
	the Company's authorized and paid-in capital amounts to R$2,740,662, represented by 378,066,162 (408,066,162 in 2014) registered
	common shares, without par value, of which 10,584,756 (29,881,286 in 2014) were held in treasury.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	According to the Company&rsquo;s
	by-laws, capital may be increased without further amendments, upon resolution of the Board of Directors, which shall set the conditions
	for issuance up to the limit of 600,000,000 (six hundred million) common shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On February 02, 2015, the Company
	approved the creation of a new program to repurchase its common shares aimed at holding them in treasury and later selling or cancelling
	them, over a period of 365 days, up to the limit of 27,000,000 shares. On the same date it took the resolution to cancel 30,000,000
	(27,493,039 in 2014) common shares of the Company held in treasury, without capital reduction. In the year ended December 31, 2015,
	11,925,330 (43,783,234 in 2014) shares were acquired totaling R$24,157 (115,265 in 2014). Additionally, the Company transferred
	1,221,860 shares (5,463,395 in 2014) in the total amount of R$3,022 (R$17,583 in 2014) related to the exercise of options under
	the stock option plan of common shares by the beneficiaries, for which it received the total amount of R$599 (R$6,921 in 2014).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
	18.2.
</TD>
<TD>
	Allocation of profit (loss) for the year
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT">
	According to the Company&rsquo;s by-laws, profit
	for the year is allocated as follows, after deduction of occasional accumulated losses and provision for taxes and social contribution:
	(i) 5% to legal reserve, until it reaches 20% of capital or when the legal reserve balance plus the balances of capital reserves
	exceeds 30% of capital ; (ii) 25% of the remaining balance to pay mandatory dividends; and (iii) amount not in excess of 71.25%
	to set up the Reserve for Investments, with the purpose of financing the expansion of the operations of the Company and its subsidiaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT">
	The absorption of losses for 2014 by the income reserve
	and allocation of net income for 2015 are as follow:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.65PT">
	&nbsp;

	Stock option plan
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	-- Continued
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Gafisa
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company has a total of four
	stock option plans comprising common shares, launched in 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2015 which follows the rules established in the Stock
	Option Plan of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The granted options entitle their
	holders (employees) to purchase common shares of the Company&rsquo;s capital, after periods that vary from one to five years of
	employment in the Company (essential condition to exercise the option), and expire six to ten years after the grant date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The fair value of options is set
	on the grant date, and it is recognized as expense in profit or loss for the year (as contra-entry to equity) during the vesting
	period of the plan, to the extent the services are provided by employees and management members.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Changes in the stock options outstanding
	in the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, including the respective weighted average exercise prices are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	pricing granted options are the Binomial model for traditional options and the MonteCarlo model for options in the Restricted Stock
	Options format.

	granted totaled R$3,232 (R$7,464 in 2014), which was determined based on the following assumptions:

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	(*)The volatility was determined
	based on regression analysis of the ratio of the share volatility of Gafisa S.A. to the Ibovespa index.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	For the year ended December 31, 2014, the Company recognized in the account &ldquo;Other
	income (expenses), net&rdquo;, the expenses with the stock option plan of the former subsidiary Alphaville Urbanismo S.A., in the
	amount of R$17,679 related to the balance payable of exercised options, according to the contract between the parties (Note 23).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Tenda
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Due to the acquisition by Gafisa
	of the total shares outstanding issued by Tenda, the stock option plans related to Tenda shares were transferred to Gafisa, responsible
	for share issuance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Tenda has a stock option plan for
	common shares, created in 2014, by which a total of 42,259,687 stock options were granted to employees and management members of
	the subsidiary, with exercise dates between March 31, 2017 and March 31, 2020.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The granted options entitle their
	holders (employees) to purchase common shares of the Company&rsquo;s capital, after periods that vary from five to ten years of
	employment in the Company (essential condition to exercise the option), and expire ten years after the grant date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31, 2015,
	the subsidiary Tenda did not grant options in connection with its stock option plan for common shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
	18.4.
</TD>
<TD>
	Share-based payment &ndash;
<I>
	Phantom Shares
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 78PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31, 2015,
	a cash-settled share-based payment program was approved, with fixed terms and conditions. The beneficiaries were granted the right
	to receive an amount equivalent to 1,898,886 phantom shares, together with the stock option plan for the year 2015. The phantom
	shares have the same grace and expiration period of the options, and can be partially or fully exercised during the established
	period. &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 78PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 78PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the amount
	of R$889, related to the fair value of the phantom shares granted, is recognized in the heading &ldquo;Other payables&rdquo; (Note
	15).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 78PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	19.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Income tax and social contribution
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Current income tax and social contribution
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Brazilian Transitory Tax Regime (RTT)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	adopted the Brazilian Transitory Tax Regime (RTT) in the year 2014 that permitted to exclude the effect from the changes, introduced
	by Laws No. 11,638/2007 and No. 11,941/2009, from the tax basis of certain taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Law No. 12,973/14 revoked the RTT
	from 2015. Such rule establishes that the adjustments should be made to the taxable profit and the accounting records for determining
	the tax bases of the corporate income tax (IRPJ) and social contribution on net income (CSLL). The end of the RTT was optional
	for the year 2014 and mandatory from 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Deferred income tax and social contribution
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company recognized deferred
	tax assets on tax losses and income tax and social contribution carryforwards for prior years, which have no expiration, and for
	which offset is limited to 30% of annual taxable profit, to the extent the taxable profit is likely to be available for offsetting
	temporary differences, based on the assumptions and conditions established in the business model of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The initial recognition and subsequent
	estimates of deferred income tax are carried out when it is probable that a taxable profit for the following years will be available
	to offset the deferred tax asset, based on projections of results prepared and underlain by internal assumptions and future economic
	scenarios that enable its total or partial use. As of December 31,2015 and 2014, the Company did not recognize any deferred tax
	assets calculated on the tax loss of the subsidiary Tenda.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015 and 2014,
	deferred income tax and social contribution are from the following sources:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	(ii)&#9;

	Deferred income tax
	and social contribution

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company has income tax and
	social contribution loss carryforwards for offset in the following amounts:

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In September 2015, the Company
	adhered to the Tax Refinance program (REFIS), originally introduced by Law No. 11,941/2009 and reopened by means of Law No. 12,996/2014,
	which provided new conditions for lump sum or installment payment of tax-related debits with the Federal Revenue Service or the
	Office of Attorney-General of the National Treasury. The Company opted for the installment payment of the tax debits of certain
	controlled SPEs in the total amount of R$6,291.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	20.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Financial instruments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	engage in operations involving financial instruments. These instruments are managed through operational strategies and internal
	controls aimed at providing liquidity, return and safety. The use of financial instruments with the objective of hedging is achieved
	through a periodical analysis of exposure to the risk that the management intends to cover (exchange, interest rate, etc.) which
	is submitted to the corresponding Management bodies for approval and performance of the proposed strategy. The control policy consists
	of continuously monitoring the contracted conditions in relation to the prevailing market conditions. The Company and its subsidiaries
	do not use derivatives or any other risky assets for speculative purposes. The result from these operations is consistent with
	the policies and strategies devised by Company management. The Company and its subsidiaries operations are subject to the following
	risk factors:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Risk considerations
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Credit risk
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	restrict their exposure to credit risks associated with cash and cash equivalents, investing only in short-term securities of top
	tier financial institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	With regards to accounts receivable,
	the Company restricts its exposure to credit risks through sales to a broad base of customers and ongoing credit analysis. Additionally,
	there is no relevant history of losses due to the existence of secured guarantee, represented by real estate unit, for the recovery
	of its products in the cases of default during the construction period. As of December 31, 2015 and 2014, there was no significant
	credit risk concentration associated with clients.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Derivative financial instruments
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company holds derivative instruments
	to mitigate the risk arising from its exposure to index and interest volatility recognized at their fair value in profit or loss
	for the year. Pursuant to its treasury policies, the Company does not own or issue derivative financial instruments other than
	for hedging purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company
	had derivative contracts for hedging purposes in relation to interest fluctuations, with final maturity between June 2016 and January
	2020. The derivative contracts are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 217 -->

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On March 17, 2015, the Company bought derivative swap transaction to mitigate the exposure to the
	floating rate at IPCA + 8.22% p.a. of the tenth Debenture Placement of the Company to 120% of CDI (Note 13).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	During the year ended December 31,
	2015, the amount of R$17,151 (R$7,492 in 2014 and R$5,102 in 2013), which refers to net result of the interest swap transaction,
	was recognized in the &ldquo;financial income (expenses)&rdquo; line in the statement of profit or loss for the year, allowing
	correlation between the impact of such transactions and interest rate fluctuation in the Company&rsquo;s consolidated financial
	statements (Note
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
</FONT>
	24).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The estimated fair value of derivative financial instruments contracted by the Company was
	determined based on information available in the market and specific valuation methodologies. However, considerable judgment was
	necessary for interpreting market data to produce the estimated fair value of each transaction, which may vary upon the financial
	settlement of transactions.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Interest rate risk
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Interest rate risk arises from the
	possibility that the Company and its subsidiaries may experience gains or losses because of fluctuations in the interest rates
	of its financial assets and liabilities. Aiming to mitigating this risk, the Company and its subsidiaries seek to diversify funding
	in terms of fixed and floating rates. The interest rates on loans, financing and debentures are disclosed in Notes 12 and 13. The
	interest rates contracted on financial investments are disclosed in Note 4. Accounts receivable from real estate units completed
	(Note 5), are subject to annual interest rate of 12%, appropriated on a
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	F-

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	20.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Financial instruments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(i)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Risk considerations
</U>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
</FONT>
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	d)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Liquidity risk
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Liquidity risk refers to the possibility
	that the Company and its subsidiaries do not have sufficient funds to meet their commitments as they become due.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	To mitigate liquidity risks, and
	to optimize the weighted average cost of capital, the Company and its subsidiaries monitor on an on-going basis the indebtedness
	levels according to the market standards and the fulfillment of covenants provided for in loan, financing and debenture agreements,
	in order to guarantee that the operating-cash generation and the advance funding, when necessary, are sufficient to meet the schedule
	of commitments (Notes 12 and 13).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The maturities of financial instruments,
	loans, financing, suppliers, payables to venture partners and debentures are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<U>
	Fair value classification
</U>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company uses the following classification
	to determine and disclose the fair value of financial instruments by the valuation technique:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Level 1: quoted prices (without
	adjustments) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Level 2: input different from the
	quoted prices in active markets included in Level 1, which are observable, directly (as prices) or indirectly (prices derivate);
	and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Level 3: inputs to asset or liability
	not based on observable market data (nonobservable inputs).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 219 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-

	62

</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the years ended December 31,
	2015 and 2014, there were no transfers between the Levels 1 and 2 fair value classifications, nor were transfers between Levels
	3 and 2 fair value classifications.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Fair value of financial instruments
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Fair value measurement
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The following estimate fair values
	were determined using available market information and proper measurement methodologies. However, a considerable amount of judgment
	is necessary to interpret market information and estimate fair value. Accordingly, the estimates presented in this document are
	not necessarily indicative of amounts that the Company could realize in the current market. The use of different market assumptions
	and/or estimation methodology may have a significant effect on estimated fair values.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The following methods and assumptions
	were used in order to estimate the fair value for each financial instrument type for which the estimate of values is practicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The amounts of cash and cash equivalents, short-term investments and accounts receivable, suppliers,
	and other current liabilities approximate to their fair values, recorded in the consolidated financial statements.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The fair value of bank loans and other financial debts is estimated through future cash flows discounted
	using rates that are annually available for similar and outstanding debts or terms.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	20.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Financial instruments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Fair value of financial instruments
</U>
	-- Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	b)
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Risk of debt acceleration
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company
	has loans and financing, with restrictive covenants related to cash generation, indebtedness ratios and other. These restrictive
	covenants have been complied with by the Company and do not limit its ability to conduct its business as usual.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	c)
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Market risk
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company carries out the development,
	construction and sales of real estate ventures. In addition to the risks that affect the real estate market as a whole, such as
	supply disruptions and volatility in the prices of construction materials and equipment, changes in the supply and demand for ventures
	in certain regions, strikes and environmental rules and zoning, the Company&rsquo;s operations are particularly affected by the
	following risks:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Brazilian economy, which may inhibit the development
	of the real estate industry as a whole, through the slowdown in economy, increase in interest rates, fluctuation of currency and
	political instability, besides other factors.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Future impediments, as a result of a new regulation
	or market conditions, to index receivables using inflation indexes, as currently permitted, which could make a venture financially
	or economically unviable.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The level of interest of buyers in a new venture
	launched or the sale price per unit necessary to sell all units may be below expectations, making the venture less profitable than
	expected.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	In the event of bankruptcy or significant
	financial difficulties of a large company of the real estate industry, the industry as a whole may be adversely affected, which
	could decrease the customer confidence in other companies operating in the industry.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Local and regional real estate market conditions,
	such as oversupply, land shortage or significant increase in land acquisition cost.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Risk of buyers having a negative perception
	of the security, convenience and appeal of the Company&rsquo;s properties, as well as about their location.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">

	affected by the increase in operating costs, including investments, insurance premium, taxes in general and government rates.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The opportunities for development may decrease.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The building and sale of real estate units
	may not be completed as scheduled, thus increasing the construction costs or cancellation of sale contracts and fines for delay
	in construction work.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Delinquency after the delivery of units acquired
	on credit. The Company has the right to file a collection action to receive the amounts due and/or repossess the real estate unit
	from the delinquent buyer, not being possible to guarantee that it will be able to recover the total amount of the debt balance
	or, once the real estate unit is repossessed, its sale on satisfactory conditions.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Occasional change in the policies of the National
	Monetary Council (CMN) on the investment of funds in the National Housing System (SFH) may reduce the supply of financing to customers.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Drop in the market value of land held in inventory,
	before the development of a real estate venture to which it was intended, and the incapacity to maintain the margins that were
	previously projected for such developments.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(iii)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	Capital management
</U>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	objective of the Company&rsquo;s capital management is to guarantee that a strong credit rating is maintained in institutions and
	an optimum capital ratio, in order to support the Company&rsquo;s business and maximize value to shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	Company controls its capital structure by making adjustments and adapting to current economic conditions. In order to maintain
	its structure adjusted, the Company may pay dividends, return on capital to shareholders, raise new loans and issue debentures,
	among others.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	There
	were no changes in objectives, policies or procedures during the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
	Company included in its net debt structure: loans and financing, debentures, obligations assumed on assignment of receivables and
	payables to venture partners less cash and cash equivalents and short-term investments (cash and cash equivalents and short-term
	investments):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	The
	sensitivity analysis of financial instruments for the years ended December 31, 2015, except swap contracts, which are analyzed
	through their due dates, describing the risks that may incur material losses on the Company&rsquo;s profit or loss, as provided
	for by CVM, through Rule No. 475/08, in order to show a 25% and 50% increase/decrease in the risk variable considered.
</FONT>

</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-INDENT: 6.55PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	For
	the sensitivity analysis in the year December 31, 2015, the Company considered the interest rates of investments, loans and accounts
	receivables, the CDI rate at 14.14%, the TR at 1.48%, the INCC rate at 7.22%, and the National Consumer Price Index &ndash; Extended
	(IPCA) at 10.67%. The scenarios considered were as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Scenario
	I &ndash; Probable:
</I>
	10% increase/decrease in the risk variables used for pricing
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Scenario
	II &ndash; Possible:
</I>
	25% increase/decrease in the risk variables used for pricing
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	Scenario
	III &ndash;
</I>
<I>
	Remote
</I>
	: 50% increase/decrease in the risk variables used for pricing
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	of December 31, 2015. The effects on equity are basically the same ones on profit or loss.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Gafisa S.A.

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Notes to the consolidated financial
	statements--Continued
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(Amounts in thousands of Brazilian
	Reais, except as otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	21.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Related parties
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
	21.1.
</TD>
<TD>
	Balances with related parties
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	--Continued
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company participates in the development of real estate ventures with other partners,
	directly or through related parties, based on the formation of condominiums and/or consortia. The management structure of these
	ventures and the cash management are centralized in the lead partner of the venture, which manages the construction schedule and
	budgets. Thus, the lead partner ensures that the investments of the necessary funds are made and allocated as planned. The sources
	and use of resources of the venture are reflected in these balances, observing the respective interest of each investor, which
	are not subject to indexation or financial charges and do not have a fixed maturity date. Such transactions aim at simplifying
	business relations that demand the joint management of amounts reciprocally owed by the involved parties and, consequently, the
	control over the change of amounts reciprocally granted which offset against each other at the time the current account is closed.
	The average term for the development and completion of the ventures in which the resources are invested is between 24 and 30 months.
	The Company receives a compensation for the management of these ventures.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Refers to transactions between the consortia leader, partners and condominiums.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Refers to operations in third-party&rsquo;s works.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(d)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The loans of the Company with its associates, shown below, are made to provide associates
	with cash to carry out their respective activities, subject to the respective agreed-upon financial charges. The businesses and
	operations with related parties are carried out in extremely commutative conditions, in order to protect the interests of the both
	parties involved in the business. The composition, nature and condition of loan receivable by the Company are shown below. Maturities
	for these loans range from June 2016 to the duration of the related real estate developments.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The amount related to the stock
	compensation of the Company&rsquo;s management was R$4,428 in the year ended December 31, 2015 (R$9,744 and R$7,164 for the years
	ended December 31, 2014 and 2013, respectively).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The maximum aggregate compensation
	of the Company&rsquo;s management members for the year 2015, was established at R$13,228, as approved at the Annual Shareholders&rsquo;
	Meeting held on April 16, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On the same occasion the compensation
	limit of the Fiscal Council members for their next term of office that ends in the Annual Shareholders&rsquo; Meeting to be held
	in 2016, was approved at R$205.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The subsidiary Tenda has an administrative
	structure segregated from the Company, therefore, the amounts recorded in the heading &ldquo;General and Administrative Expenses&rdquo;
	in the consolidated balance are added by the compensation of its Management members and are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The maximum aggregate compensation
	of the subsidiary Tenda&rsquo;s management members for the year 2015, was established at R$14,696, as approved at the Annual Shareholders&rsquo;
	Meeting held on April 22, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On the same occasion the compensation
	limit of the Fiscal Council members for their next term of office that ends in the Annual Shareholders&rsquo; Meeting to be held
	in 2016, was approved at R$149.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Sales
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31,
	2015, there were no units sold to the Management (R$1,513 in 2014) and the total receivables is R$1,610 (R$4,686 in 2014).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Profit sharing
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company has a profit sharing
	plan that entitles its employees and management members, and those of its subsidiaries to participate in the distribution of profits
	of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	This plan is tied to the achievement
	of specific targets, established, agreed-upon and approved by the Board of Directors at the beginning of each year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the year ended December 31,
	2015, the Company recorded a provision for profit sharing amounting R$25,502 in the consolidated statement (R$35,006 in 2014) in
	the account &ldquo;General and Administrative Expenses&quot; (Nota 23).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Profit sharing is calculated and
	reserved based on the achievement of the Company&rsquo;s targets for the period. An assessment is performed subsequent to year-end
	of the achievement of the Company&rsquo;s and its employees&rsquo; targets. The payment shall be made in April
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
</FONT>
	2016.

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	26.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Insurance
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Gafisa S.A. and its subsidiaries
	maintain insurance policies against engineering risk, barter guarantee, guarantee for the completion of the work and civil liability
	related to unintentional personal damages caused to third parties and material damages to tangible assets, as well as against fire
	hazards, lightning strikes, electrical damages, natural disasters and gas explosion. The contracted coverage is considered sufficient
	by management to cover possible risks involving its assets and/or responsibilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The liabilities covered by insurance
	and the respective amounts as of December 31, 2015 are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	27.
</TD>
<TD>
	Earning (loss) per share
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	In accordance with CPC 41, the Company presents basic
	and diluted loss per share. The comparison data of basic and diluted earnings/loss per share is based on the weighted average number
	of shares outstanding for the year, and all dilutive potential shares outstanding for each year presented, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT">
	Diluted earnings per share is computed similarly
	to basic earnings per share except that the outstanding shares are increased to include the number of additional shares that would
	have been outstanding if the potential dilutive shares attributable to stock options and redeemable shares of non-controlling interest
	had been issued during the respective periods, utilizing the weighted average stock price.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT">
	The following table shows the calculation of basic
	and diluted profit or loss per share. In view of the loss for the year ended December 31, 2014, shares with dilutive potential
	are not considered, because the impact would be antidilutive.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT">
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	28.
</TD>
<TD>
	Segment information
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company's management assesses
	segment information on the basis of different business segments rather than based on the geographical regions of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	The Company operates in the following segments: Gafisa
	(for ventures targeted at high and medium income) and Tenda (for ventures targeted at low income).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company's chief executive officer,
	who is responsible for allocating resources to businesses and monitoring their progresses, uses economic present value data, which
	is derived from a combination of historical and forecasted operating results.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The table below provides certain
	information related to each segment in the statement of profit or loss and balance sheet.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Segment information provided to
	the chief operating decision maker does not segregate operating expenses. No revenues from an individual client represented more
	than 10% of net sales and/or services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(213,234,234)">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 67%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Net operating revenue
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The unappropriated sales revenue of units sold are measured by the face value of contracts,
	plus the contract adjustments and deducted from cancellations, net of the levied taxes and adjustment to present value, and do
	not include ventures that are subject to restriction due to a suspensive clause (legal period of 180 days in which the Company
	can cancel a development) and therefore is not appropriated to profit or loss.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The unappropriated estimated cost of units sold do not include financial charges, which are
	appropriated to properties for sale and profit or loss (cost of real estate sold) in proportion to the real estate units sold at
	the extent they are accrued, and also the warranty provision, which is appropriated to real estate units as the construction work
	progresses.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT">
</TD>
<TD>
	As of December 31, 2015, the percentage of consolidated assets in the financial statements related to real estate developments
	included in asset segregation structure was 33.1%.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
